title: How to say sorry for a misunderstanding - Quora

response.answer_text: If you misunderstood them, explain what you thought they said and make it clear that you now know they didn’t mean it. Take responsibility for any hurt or offense you caused. “I’m so sorry! I thought you said that the moon is made of cheddar cheese. That’s why I laughed, I honestly believed it was a joke. Of course you meant that the moon really is made of green cheese, which is serious, and nothing to joke about. I didn’t mean to disrespect or offend you in any way.” If they misunderstood you, do basically the same thing in reverse. Explain what you meant, take responsibility for any hurt or offense, etc etc. “I’m so sorry, that came out completely wrong. I didn’t mean that the moon is made of cheddar cheese, although I understand how it could have sounded that way. Of course we both know that the moon really is made of green cheese. I didn’t mean to disrespect or offend you in any way.”

I think your question is incomplete. You already know the answer: “How can I say sorry for a misunderstanding?” In reality, your question is the time-honored, “How can I say sorry for a misunderstanding” when it really means How can I apologize for misunderstanding without having to deal with the stress of admitting it? Here’s the thing about admitting guilt: It’s usually painful — first when you admit it to yourself and later when you admit it to the person you misunderstood. You can rationalize your way out of it but it’ll always bother you. The best course of action is to grow-up and admit it: “I’m sorry for our misunderstanding and I apologize to you for it. I’d like us to put it behind us. Again, I apologize.” There. It’s done and maybe you and your friend can move on. Thanks for asking, Janet
